crimeprediction package¶

Submodules¶

crimeprediction.error_analysis module¶

crimeprediction.error_analysis.build_model(dim, X)[source]¶

build function required by Scikit-Learn’s learning curve function

Parameters:
  • dim – dimension of the inputs
  • X – data vector
Return type:

contructed model
crimeprediction.error_analysis.plot_learning_curve(grid_size, period, crime_type=None, seasonal=False)[source]¶
Plots the learning curve using Scikit-Learn’s learning_curve function,

plots the graph using matplotlib and save sit

param grid_size:
 size of the cell dimension for the grid
param period:timestep of crime data
param crime_type:
 type of crime to be trained, None value will train all
param seasonal:implement seasonality or not

crimeprediction.experiments module¶

crimeprediction.experiments.run_experiments()[source]¶

Perfrom all experiments by running network under all possible conditions

crimeprediction.network module¶

crimeprediction.network.get_trained_model()[source]¶

reconstruct trained model from saved files

Return type:a tuple of the model constructed and a yaml string of parameters

used

crimeprediction.network.predict_next(model, **params)[source]¶

predicts next crime hotspots

Parameters:
  • model – the model to be used for prediction
  • **params –

    a yaml string of the parameters used by the model
crimeprediction.network.run_network(grid_size, period, crime_type=None, seasonal=False)[source]¶

Build, train and run LSTM network

Parameters:
  • grid_size – size of the cell dimension for the grid
  • period – timestep of crime data
  • crime_type – type of crime to be trained, None value will train all
  • seasonal – implement seasonality or not
crimeprediction.network.save_trained_model(model, params_string)[source]¶

saves trained model to directory and files depending on settings variables

Parameters:
  • model – model to be saved
  • params_string – a yaml string of parameters used for the model: crime_type, period, grid_size and seasonality

crimeprediction.vectorize module¶

crimeprediction.vectorize.vectorize(grid_size, period, crime_type=None, seasonal=False, new=False)[source]¶
Vectorize crime data fetched from the database. The vector is saved to a
pickle file and then retrieved later
Parameters:
  • grid_size – size of the cell dimension for the grid
  • period – timestep of crime data
  • crime_type – type of crime to be trained, None value will train all
  • seasonal – implement seasonality or not
  • new – will override the old one pickle file if and if True
Raises:

EnvironmentError, NotImplementedError
Return type:

returns the resulting vector
crimeprediction.vectorize.vectorize_weekly(grid, crime_type=None, seasonal=False)[source]¶

Special vectorization for weekly data

Parameters:
  • grid_size – size of the cell dimension for the grid
  • crime_type – type of crime to be trained, None value will train all
  • seasonal – implement seasonality or not
Return type:

returns the resulting vector
